heading: Who receives the most migrants?
subheading: In 2023, there were an estimated 16 non-EU immigrants per 1 000 EU inhabitants, with Malta having the highest rate (78 immigrants per 1 000 inhabitants) and France having the lowest rate (6 immigrant per 1 000 inhabitants).
textNote: Bulgaria, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Finland and Sweden did not include refugees from Ukraine who benefit from temporary protection in their population and migration statistics.
